H0.text: Autoimmune diseases occur when the immune system attacks normal body cells.

H1.text: Gastrointestinal diseases are the type of diseases that occur when the immune system attacks normal body cells.

H2.text: Liver disease is the type of disease that occurs when the immune system attacks normal body cells.

H3.text: Inflammatory diseases occur when the immune system attacks normal body cells.

A4.text: An autoimmune disease is a condition that results from an anomalous response of the adaptive immune system, wherein it mistakenly targets and attacks healthy, functioning parts of the body as if they were foreign organisms.

A5.text: Autoimmune diseases are a separate class from autoinflammatory diseases.
